name: Saint Paddy's Irish Sandwich
author: bignosekate
summary: This new rendition of a reuben is amazing. It makes my mouth water just thinking about it. Toasted sliced-sourdough, shredded corned beef, fancy mustard, and shredded cabbage in a light vinaigrette make this sandwich to die for (not just on Saint Paddy's).
ingredients: 1 (3 pound) corned beef brisket with spice packet
½ medium head cabbage, cored and sliced thin
directions: Place corned beef in large pot or Dutch oven and cover with water
Add the spice packet that came with the corned beef
Cover pot and bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer
Simmer approximately 50 minutes per pound until tender
Remove meat and let rest 15 minutes
Whisk together olive oil, balsamic vinegar, mustard, salt, and pepper in small bowl
Place the shredded cabbage in a large bowl and pour the dressing over it; toss to coat the cabbage with the dressing
Spread a layer of mustard on 6 slices of toasted bread
Place some shredded cabbage and corned beef on each slice and top with remaining slices of bread
